definitions: A container for a loose bulk material such as grain, rock, or rubbish, typically one that tapers downward and is able to discharge its contents at the bottom.
A tapering container, working with a hopping motion, through which grain passed into a mill.
A railway wagon able to discharge coal or other bulk material through its floor.
A barge for carrying away mud or sediment from a dredging machine and discharging it.
A container at the top of a vertical pipe which receives water from a gutter or waste pipe.
A person or thing that hops.
A hopping insect, especially a young locust.
